title: Introduction
text:
Introduction
The Cycling in Montpellier website offers an in-depth exploration of cycling traffic in the city, combining interactive visualizations and dynamic data analysis. It allows for the examination of circulation trends, identification of peak traffic periods, and an understanding of cyclistsâ€™ behaviors over time. With interactive tools such as videos, maps, and graphs, this platform provides a detailed and insightful view of the evolution of cycling traffic in Montpellier, making it a valuable resource for better understanding bicycle use in the city.


Density over a Day
The video below allows real-time visualization of data related to bicycle journeys within the city for a specific day (2024-10-07). It provides a dynamic representation of cyclistsâ€™ movements, with routes traced on the map, enabling the tracking of journey intensity. Based on the density of these journeys in specific areas, points are displayed on the map: they appear small when there are few passages and increase in size proportionally as the density of cyclists grows. This visualization system helps to better understand traffic flows and identify high-activity areas, facilitating the analysis of bike journey distribution in the city during this particular day. This approach enables quick recognition of trends and highlights areas to monitor, providing a clear and intuitive perspective on bicycle use in the city.





Traffic Prediction
Discover our interactive map, which allows you to explore the cycling traffic forecasts in Montpellier for each day of the week. Using historical data, this map highlights areas with high cyclist traffic. It provides an overview of traffic trends, helping to identify the most frequented areas. With this visualization, you can anticipate the zones that are likely to be the busiest. This feature enables more informed planning and helps optimize cycling movement within the city.

title: Withdrawals and Deposits of VÃ©lomagg Bikes
text:
Explore the trends of bike withdrawals and returns for VÃ©lomagg through an interactive graph that shows, day by day, the number of returns and withdrawals at each station. This dynamic visualization allows you to track the daily flow of bikes, providing a better understanding of the variations in station traffic. It also offers a detailed analysis of bike usage patterns throughout the week, helping to identify peak activity periods and optimize station management.

ðŸ“Š To view only the withdrawals or only the deposits, simply click on the corresponding option. By clicking on an option, it will disappear, allowing you to focus on the other type of data.

title: Withdrawals and Deposits of VÃ©lomagg Bikes
text:
What is an Eco-Counter?
Eco-Counters are technological devices designed to measure in real time the passage of pedestrians and cyclists in specific areas. These devices collect valuable data on movement behaviors, contributing to better infrastructure planning and more efficient mobility management.

title: Withdrawals and Deposits of VÃ©lomagg Bikes
section: Analysis of the Average Passage in Front of Eco-Counters in Montpellier in 2024
text:
Analysis of the Average Passage in Front of Eco-Counters in Montpellier in 2024
The graph below illustrates the average passage intensity of pedestrians and cyclists in front of the Eco-Counters in the city of Montpellier throughout the year 2024. These data, collected directly from the counting devices installed in various neighborhoods across the city, provide a view of the monthly variations in foot traffic in these key areas.
This graph offers a detailed overview of circulation trends, while considering the seasonal factors that naturally influence the flow of traffic. It allows for a precise analysis of the fluctuations in passage intensity over the months, and a better understanding of the mobility behaviors of the cityâ€™s inhabitants.
